au.com.systemic.framework.dao.sql
Class SQLStatementLookup

java.lang.Object
  au.com.systemic.framework.dao.sql.SQLStatementLookup

public class SQLStatementLookup
extends java.lang.Object

Programmer: Joerg Huber

Description & Usage
This class provides a lookup table for SQL statements. It is implemented as a singleton with a factory method. The main singleton holds the sql statements for each DAO class where as the factory method determines based in the DAO class name which SQLStatementLookup object to return.

Example of use
SQLStatementLookup factory = SQLStatementLookup.getInstance(DemoDAO.class);
SQLStatement stmt = factory.getStatement("getAllLibraries");
Connection conn = factory.getConnection("getAllLibraries");
...

Assumption & Constraints
It is assumed that a DAO class has a *.sql file in the same directory with the same name as the class name. For example if a class is called DemoDAO.class it must have a file called DemoDAO.sql in the same directory as the class file. The *.sql file must adhere to the following structure:

etc.

Returns:
a SQLStatementLookup for the client

getStatement

public SQLStatement getStatement(java.lang.String stmtID)
This method returns the SQLStatemnt object for the given stmtID. If no such object exists then null os returned.

Parameters:
stmtID - The ID for which a SQLStatement object shall be returned.
Returns:
SQLStatement or null.

loadSqlDocument

public org.jdom.Document loadSqlDocument(java.lang.String sqlFileName,
                                         java.lang.Class clazz)
Loads the given file which contains sql the statements. If the file cannot be loaded or has an incorrect format then null is returned.

Parameters:
sqlFileName - The file name of the sql file top be loaded.
clazz - The class through which the sql is loaded.
Returns:
A xml Document that can be parsed afterwards. Null is returned if the file doesn't exist or has incorrect data (no XML).
